description: Subaru is a young girl who discovers that her best friend Aoi is part of a magical group trying to gather engine fragments so that a little being from Pleiades can return to his home. Subaru considers joining them as she was chosen by the Pleiadian, president of this afterschool club.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__[Website](https://kano-official.amebaownd.com/) | [Old Website (Warner Bros)](https://whv-amusic.com/kano/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kano_2525) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCShXNLMXCfstmWKH_q86B8w) | [Nico Nico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/15078610)__


__Introduction:__
Kano is a Japanese vocalist under record label Imperial Records (2018–), having previously been under Warner Bros. Home Entertainment (2015–2018).

__Biography:__
She made her initial debut in 2010, where she would post covers of songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga. A couple of years later in 2012, Kano would make her first original VOCALOID song titled "[Toumei Ningen no Nihilism](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm16824160)".

It wasn't until 2015, a whole 3 years later, that Kano would release what would be known as her major debut, and which would also become her most popular song to date. Her major debut was the song "[Stella-rium](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNkPJvVEm0s)", which would release through the record label Warner Bros. Home Entertainment as her first single. The song first aired as an opening theme to the TV anime _[Houkago no Pleiades](https://anilist.co/anime/17919/Houkago-no-Pleiades/)_, featuring a shorter TV Size version. The full version of the song released later on May 20, 2015.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).

__[Website](https://www.tsubasanium.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasacurry)__ 

__Tsubasa Itou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator.

__[Website](https://www.tsubasanium.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasacurry)__ 

__Tsubasa Itou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/samfree33/)__

__Date of Birth:__ September 9, 1984
__Birthplace:__ Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Chuubu Region, Japan

__Takayuki Sano__, better known as samfree, otherwise known as SAM, was a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer active between 2007 and 2015, who sadly lost his life at the age of 31. He was particularly involved in composing and arranging songs using Vocaloid software, while also notably involved in producing theme songs in anime.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/kumanokiyomi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyokinomaku) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kiyomi.kumano)__

__Birthplace.__ Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Kiyomi Kumano__ is a freelance Japanese vocalist and lyricist.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/samfree33/)__

__Date of Birth:__ September 9, 1984
__Birthplace:__ Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Chuubu Region, Japan

__Takayuki Sano__, better known as samfree, otherwise known as SAM, was a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer active between 2007 and 2015, who sadly lost his life at the age of 31. He was particularly involved in composing and arranging songs using Vocaloid software, while also notably involved in producing theme songs in anime.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/149372/), different kanji._

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.
